job_title: Cloud Support Analyst in Toronto, ON
pros: Great, friendly, down-to-earth people to work with. A non-profit organization full of heart, comprising over 90% immigrants, they operate on a hybrid work model (work from home + at the office). Management and staff made me feel very supported and welcomed, as a Canadian newcomer on a work permit. They went above and beyond to help me transition to this new job.
cons: It's not really a con to me, but if you're one to dabble in a wide range of skills, then this is a place you will fit right in. The culture is more like a start-up where everyone pitches in. Your strengths will be highlighted and welcomed.

pros: A mid sized non profit social enterprise which grows organically and incrementally placing social purpose of upholding the human right to be informed, heard and understood above all else. Has allowed me to grow and given me an opportunity to serve Canada working for an ethical organization providing high quality language solutions
cons: Growth is incremental and organic and when we refuse to compete on price because we do not want to pay exploitive wages, it is somewhat challenging

review_title: MCIS Language Services - small non-profit/social enterprise
pros:
* Professional staff
* Close to the highway (DVP)
* Free parking
cons:
* Very Low Salary
* High turnover
* Poor benefits

job_title: Centralized IS Coordinator in North York, ON
cons: All of my experiences were good

pros: Professional , life/work flexible, work own time
cons: Low hrs, like to have more hours
Less assignments even no assignments within weeks

pros: Very nice place to work.  Canadian experience at its best
cons: Long working hours that might go beyond 5:00 p.m.
